text: The Chicano Movement, also known as El Movimiento, was a social and political movement inspired by acts of resistance from people of Mexican descent in the 1940s and 1950s, and the Black Power movement, that worked to support a Chicano/a identity. The Chicano Movement was heavily influenced by and entwined with the Black Power movement. ==References== Category:1940s in the United States Category:1950s in the United States
title: Chicano Movement
